meanings.definition: A person who works with or makes objects out of ivory.
meanings.sent1: The skilled ivorier carefully carved intricate designs into the ivory.
meanings.sent2: The ivorier displayed beautiful ivory sculptures at the art exhibition.
meanings.sent3: The young ivorier accidentally turned a block of ivory into a tiny elephant statue.
meanings.sent4: Her hands moved with precision, like an ivorier crafting a masterpiece from ivory.
meanings.sent5: The renowned ivorier's workshop was filled with the sweet scent of ivory shavings.

meanings.definition: A substance resembling ivory in color or texture.
meanings.sent1: The antique vase had an ivorier hue, reminiscent of ivory.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a paint that dried to an ivorier finish for the portrait.
meanings.sent3: The cake frosting looked so smooth and ivorier, it could be mistaken for ivory.
meanings.sent4: The clouds in the sky glowed with an ivorier tint as the sun set.
meanings.sent5: Her dress was a soft, ivorier shade that complemented her skin tone perfectly.

meanings.definition: To make or decorate with ivory.
meanings.sent1: She decided to ivorier the jewelry box by adding delicate ivory inlays.
meanings.sent2: The artisan carefully ivoriered the frame of the mirror with ivory accents.
meanings.sent3: He tried to ivorier his phone case with ivory stickers, but they kept peeling off.
meanings.sent4: The palace walls were ivoriered with intricate ivory carvings that gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The tradition was to ivorier the ceremonial masks with ivory beads for a touch of elegance.
